topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55728b576368727e53970300#post_55728b576368727e53970300
[bq="Princess♠Molestia"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55728b2e63687228536a1200#post_55728b2e63687228536a1200
There was a shitstorm?[/bq]
Not to summon a shitstorm in this thread, but one of the women on the team was a sjw; she got fired for improper conduct.  A metric shit ton of people like that are currently getting blanket fired for improper conduct currently in the video game industry cause using a company's name for political agenda is often times considered improper conduct or such.

To use an analogy let's say you log onto the company you work for and use their twitter account to tell people to vote for say Hillary; 99% of the time you would get fired off the bad for improper conduct on the job.  The reason why the woman in question got fired was that she was using the company for a ideological gain.

Tl:dr; Most companies will fire you if you use the company for political ideological gain without the company's consent beforehand.

"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55728d946368723157080900#post_55728d946368723157080900

Not even close.

Here's the thing, imagine you work for a cable company and you begin to say "Give Cats the Right to Vote" and you use the company's advertising team/equipment to tell people both online and via TVSpots "Give Cats the right to vote, this company is also on board with that" and not only you didn't told them, you are doing it behind their backs.
